ur: اللہ کے نام کے ساتھ جو بے انتہا رحم کرنے والا، بِن مانگے دینے والا (اور) بار بار رحم کرنے والا ہے۔

v5.text: [a]In the name of Allah, the Gracious, the Merciful.

notes.note: See 1:1.

topics.topic: Day of Requital: Resurrection, Yaumul-Qiyamah, Yaumud-Din, Yaumul-Akhirah, Yaumul-Ba‘th

ur: خبردار! میں قیامت کے دن کی قسم کھاتا ہوں۔

v5.text: Nay! I call to witness the Day of Resurrection.[4457]

notes.note:
Commentary:

For the nature, significance and philosophy of Quranic oaths see detailed notes on 91:2 and 37:2. One object of oaths, however, is to lay emphasis on the importance of the subject about which an oath is taken.

لا (nay) is used in different senses. Here it may signify, "it is not like what they think." Sometimes, it is used as an answer to some objection or in repudiation of what is said before. In this and the next verse it is used to refute the disbelievers’ assertion made in v. 4, about the impossibility of the Resurrection and also to emphasize the importance of the oath.

القیامة (the Resurrection) signifying a great and calamitous occurrence, may refer to three events: (a) The death of a person is called القیامة الصغریٰ i.e. the small resurrection. It is to this resurrection that reference is made in the famous hadith, viz. من مات فقد قامت قیامته i.e. he who dies, his resurrection has indeed taken place. (b) The moral death of a whole people or nation. This is called القامة الوسطی i.e. the Middle Resurrection. (c) The Final Resurrection. The word قیامة (resurrection) has been used in the Quran in all these three senses.

topics.topic: Day of Requital: Resurrection, Yaumul-Qiyamah, Yaumud-Din, Yaumul-Akhirah, Yaumul-Ba‘th

ur: اور خبردار! میں سخت ملامت کرنے والے نفس کی بھی قَسم کھاتا ہوں۔

v5.text: And I do call to witness the self-accusing soul, that the Day of Judgement is a certainty.[4458]

notes.note:
Commentary:

The Quran has mentioned three stages of development of the human soul. The first stage is called النفس الامارة i.e. the uncontrollable spirit or the spirit prone to evil, when the animal in man is predominant.

The second stage is that of النفس اللوامة i.e. the self-accusing spirit, when man begins to be conscious of evil, that is, when his awakened conscience upbraids him for doing bad deeds and restrains his passions and appetites. In moments of weakness of the flesh, in this stage, he may falter or fall, but will not perish, every failure bringing with it a fresh reproach and repentance. The human in man gets the upper hand in him. It is the beginning of his spiritual resurrection. النفس اللوامةhas been cited here in evidence of the Final Resurrection. If man has no responsibility, if he has not to account for his deeds in an afterlife, why this pricking of conscience at the doing of an evil deed?

The highest stage of development of the human soul, however, is that of النفس المطمئنة i.e. the spirit at rest. At this stage the human soul becomes practically immune to failure or faltering and is at peace with its Creator.

topics.topic: Bones: resurrection after are turned to dust

ur: کیا انسان گمان کرتا ہے کہ ہم ہرگز اُس کی ہڈیاں اکٹھی نہیں کریں گے؟

v5.text: Does man think that We shall not assemble his bones[a]?[4459]

notes.note:
Commentary:

The objection of disbelievers, viz. when they are dead and reduced to bones and dust how would they be given a new life, is repeatedly mentioned and effectively answered in the Quran. See 17:50-52 and 36:78-80.

topics.topic: Qadir: powerful: Allah has the power to do all

ar: بَلٰی قٰدِرِیۡنَ  عَلٰۤی  اَنۡ  نُّسَوِّیَ بَنَانَہٗ ﴿۵﴾
ur: کیوں نہیں! ہم اس بات پر بہت قادر ہیں کہ اُس کی پور پور درست کردیں۔

v5.text: Yea, We have the power to restore his very fingertips[b].[4460]

notes.note:
Important Words:

بنان (fingertips) is the plural of بنانة which is derived from بن which means, he remained or stayed in a place. بنان means, fingers; ends or extremities thereof; fingertips; toes; all the limbs or members of the body; any part or all the limbs; arms or hands or legs or feet (Lane & Aqrab).

Commentary:

At another place in the Quran (36:78-80), the objection of disbelievers about life after death has been answered by stating that the Almighty Creator Who has created man from a mere sperm drop has the power to restore him to life after he is dead, but in the present verse the restoration of his fingertips has been adduced as an argument to refute the same objection. In fact, the word بنان represents man’s power and strength, as by means of his hand he grasps an object and defends himself. In fact man’s hands, i.e. his fingers, are the most important members of his body. The word بنان as given under Important Words may stand for the whole human body. Thus the verse signifies that God has the power to restore all the powers of man, or even of a whole people when, to all intents and purposes, they are dead and defunct.

ur: حقیقت یہ ہے کہ انسان یہ چاہتا ہے کہ وہ اُس کے سامنے گناہ کرتا رہے۔

v5.text: But man desires to continue to send forth evil deeds in front of him.

topics.topic: Day of Requital: Resurrection, Yaumul-Qiyamah, Yaumud-Din, Yaumul-Akhirah, Yaumul-Ba‘th: heaven and earth on

ur: وہ پوچھتا ہے قیامت کا دن کب ہوگا؟

v5.text: He asks, ‘When will be the Day of Resurrection[c]?’[4461]

notes.note:
Commentary:

The question seems to have been asked in derision or doubt. In fact, doubt about the Hereafter gives rise to a mocking attitude on the disbelievers’ part.

topics.topic: Day of Requital: Resurrection, Yaumul-Qiyamah, Yaumud-Din, Yaumul-Akhirah, Yaumul-Ba‘th: heaven and earth on

ur: تو (جواب دے کہ) جب نظر چندھیا جائے گی۔

v5.text: When the eye is dazzled,[4462]

notes.note:
Important Words:

برق (is dazzled) means, he feared so that he was astonished or amazed or stupefied at seeing the gleam of lightning; he was frightened, or he became perplexed or unable to see his right course. برق بصرہ means, his eye became dazzled or it became weak. برقت قدماہ means, his feet became weak (Lane & Aqrab).

Commentary:

The metaphor "when the eye is dazzled," signifies, "when the opponents of truth are completely confused and baffled".

topics.topic: Day of Requital: Resurrection, Yaumul-Qiyamah, Yaumud-Din, Yaumul-Akhirah, Yaumul-Ba‘th: face of disbelievers on the
Day of Requital: Resurrection, Yaumul-Qiyamah, Yaumud-Din, Yaumul-Akhirah, Yaumul-Ba‘th: heaven and earth on

ur: اور چاند گہنا جائے گا۔

v5.text: And the moon is eclipsed,[4463]

notes.note:
Commentary:

"Moon" being a symbol of the political power of the Arabs, the verse may mean: when the power of the Arabs will break and their glory will depart. Or the darkening of the moon may mean the darkening of both the sun and the moon, as the moon borrows its light from the sun, so that when the moon is darkened it means that the sun also has become dark.

topics.topic: Day of Requital: Resurrection, Yaumul-Qiyamah, Yaumud-Din, Yaumul-Akhirah, Yaumul-Ba‘th: face of disbelievers on the
Day of Requital: Resurrection, Yaumul-Qiyamah, Yaumud-Din, Yaumul-Akhirah, Yaumul-Ba‘th: heaven and earth on

ur: اور سورج اور چاند اکٹھے کئے جائیں گے۔

v5.text: And the sun and the moon are brought together,[4464]

notes.note:
Commentary:

The expression, "the sun and the moon are brought together" may signify that the whole solar system will be completely disrupted. Or the words may signify the destruction of the political power of the Arabs and of the Iranian dynasty, the moon being the symbol of the political power of the former and the sun that of the latter. Or the reference may be to the lunar and solar eclipses—a highly unusual phenomenon, which, according to a hadith was to occur in the time of the Promised Mahdi. The hadith is to the following effect: ان لمھدینا اٰیتین لم تکونا منذ خلق السموات و الارض الخ i.e. For our Mahdi there are two signs which have never been witnessed since the time when the heavens and the earth were created, viz. that the moon will be eclipsed on the first night and the sun on the second day in the month of Ramadan(Baihaqi). This meant that the day of the final triumph of Islam and that of the defeat and destruction of the forces of evil will dawn with the Mahdi’s appearance in the world. Strangely enough, both the sun and the moon were eclipsed in the month of Ramadan in 1894 after Ahmad, the Founder of the Ahmadiyya Movement had made the claim that he was the Promised Messiah and Mahdi.

topics.topic: Day of Requital: Resurrection, Yaumul-Qiyamah, Yaumud-Din, Yaumul-Akhirah, Yaumul-Ba‘th: heaven and earth on

ur: اُس دن انسان کہے گا فرار کی راہ کہاں ہے؟

v5.text: On that day man will say, ‘Whither to flee[a]?’

topics.topic: Day of Requital: Resurrection, Yaumul-Qiyamah, Yaumud-Din, Yaumul-Akhirah, Yaumul-Ba‘th: heaven and earth on

ur: خبردار! کوئی جائے پناہ نہیں۔

v5.text: Nay! There is no refuge![4465]

notes.note:
Important Words:

وزر (refuge) is derived from أوزر. They say أوزر الشیء i.e. he protected, guarded the thing; concealed it or took it away. أوزر الرجل means, he gave asylum to the man. وزر (wazarun) means, place of refuge; a high mountain; a mountain where one takes refuge (Lane & Aqrab).

ur: تیرے ربّ ہی کی طرف اُس دن جائے پناہ ہے۔

v5.text: With thy Lord alone will be the place of rest that day.

ar: یُنَبَّؤُا الۡاِنۡسَانُ یَوۡمَئِذٍۭ بِمَا قَدَّمَ وَ اَخَّرَ ﴿ؕ۱۴﴾
ur: اُس دن انسان کو باخبر کیا جائے گا کہ اس نے کیا آگے بھیجا تھا اور کیا پیچھے چھوڑا۔

v5.text: That day will man be informed of that which he has sent forward and has left behind.[4466]

notes.note:
Commentary:

The words "that which he has sent forward and has left behind," may mean, the evil deeds which man did but which he should not have done and the good deeds which he should have done but he failed to do, i.e. his sins of omission and commission.

ur: حقیقت یہ ہے کہ انسان اپنے نفس پر بہت بصیرت رکھنے والا ہے۔

v5.text: Nay, man is a witness against himself;

ur: اگرچہ وہ اپنے بڑے بڑے عذر پیش کرے۔

v5.text: Even though he puts forward his excuses.

ar: لَا تُحَرِّکۡ بِہٖ لِسَانَکَ لِتَعۡجَلَ بِہٖ ﴿ؕ۱۷﴾
ur: تُو اس کی قراءت کے وقت اپنی زبان کو اس لئے تیز حرکت نہ دے کہ تُو اسے جلد جلد یاد کرے۔

v5.text: Move not thy tongue with this revelation that thou mayest hasten to preserve it.[4467]

notes.note:
Commentary:

Bukhari reports that in the beginning when a certain portion of the Quran was revealed to the Holy Prophet, in his anxiety lest he should forget it, he would start hurriedly repeating it. It is this practice that the Prophet was enjoined in this verse to give up, because, as stated in the following three verses, God had taken upon Himself not only to safeguard the text of the Quran from being tampered with but also to see that it was collected in the form of an immaculately arranged Book (see General Introduction) and that its Message was conveyed and explained to the whole world (15:10). Or the meaning may be that, because the preceding verses referred to a day of reckoning for disbelievers, the Holy Prophet was naturally anxious that the revelation bearing upon the promised punishment should come soon. He is here told that he need have no anxiety on that score, as it was God’s own responsibility, when a revelation should descend and what form the punishment should take, and that the Quran should be collected, read and explained to the world. It may be convenient to set out here three quotations: "There is otherwise every security, internal and external, that we possess the text (of the Quran) which Muhammad himself gave forth and used" (Muir). "Efforts of European scholars to prove the existence of later interpolations in the Quran have failed" (Enc. Brit.). "The Quran is perhaps the most read book in the world. Certainly it is the most often memorized, and possibly it exerts the greatest influence on those who read it" (The Religions of Man).

Besides the meaning given in the text, the verse has also been interpreted as follows: "It is Our responsibility that We should explain the Quranic revelation through your tongue" (Ruhul-Ma‘ani). This speaks volumes for the inviolability of the Holy Prophet’s Sunnah and its indispensability as a safe and sure guide, next only to the Quran itself. For a detailed exposition, however, of this and the preceding verse see General Introduction and 15:10.

ur: یقیناً اس کا جمع کرنا اور اس کی تلاوت ہماری ذمہ داری ہے۔

v5.text: [a]Surely, upon Us rests its collection and its recital.[4468]

notes.note: See previous note 4467.

ur: پس جب ہم اُسے پڑھ چکیں تو تُو اس کی قراءت کی پیروی کر۔

v5.text: So when We recite it, then follow thou its recital.

ur: پھر یقیناً اُس کا واضح بیان بھی ہمارے ہی ذمہ ہے۔

v5.text: Then upon Us rests the expounding thereof.

topics.topic: Afterlife: Akhirah: comparison of present life with

ur: خبردار! بلکہ تم دنیا کو پسند کرتے ہو۔

v5.text: Nay, but you love the present life[a];[4469]

notes.note:
Commentary

The particle کلا besides meaning, "your assertion that Resurrection will not take place is false," has been taken to mean, "it is as certain as anything that the Resurrection shall take place (Kabir)."

topics.topic: Afterlife: Akhirah: comparison of present life with

ur: اور آخرت کو نظرانداز کر دیتے ہو۔

v5.text: And you neglect the Hereafter.

topics.topic: Day of Requital: Resurrection, Yaumul-Qiyamah, Yaumud-Din, Yaumul-Akhirah, Yaumul-Ba‘th: face of believers on

ur: بعض چہرے اُس دن تر و تازہ ہوں گے۔

v5.text: Some faces on that day will be bright,[b]

ur: اپنے ربّ کی طرف نظر لگائے ہوئے۔

v5.text: Looking eagerly towards their Lord;[4470]

notes.note:
Commentary:

The verse means that the righteous believers will look to their Lord, expecting to be rewarded for the good deeds they had done in this world. Or the meaning may be that they will be endowed with special spiritual eyes to see God; but it does not mean that God has a body and that He can be seen with our physical eyes. "Eyes cannot reach Him and He reaches the eyes and He is Incomprehensible" (6:104). The sight of God will be a special Divine manifestation, which will be unfolded to the human soul untrammelled by its earthly raiment.

topics.topic: Black: faces shall be on that day
Day of Requital: Resurrection, Yaumul-Qiyamah, Yaumud-Din, Yaumul-Akhirah, Yaumul-Ba‘th: face of disbelievers on the

ur: جبکہ بعض چہرے سخت بگڑے ہوئے ہوں گے۔

v5.text: [a]And some faces on that day will be dismal,[4470A]

notes.note:
Important Words:

باسرة (dismal) is derived from بسر which means, he frowned; contracted his face; he grinned; he was gloomy or dismal. بسر وجھه means, he frowned or he contracted his face excessively or he looked with intense dislike or hatred (Lane & Aqrab).

ur: وہ یقین کرلیں گے کہ اُن سے کمر توڑ سلوک کیا جائے گا۔

v5.text: Thinking that a back-breaking calamity is about to befall them.[4471]

notes.note:
Important Words:

فاقرة (back-breaking) is derived from فقر which means, he stigmatized a man. فقر البعیر means, he made an incision in the nose of the camel. فقرته الداھیة, means, the calamity broke the vertebrae of his back. فاقرة means, an act that breaks the vertebrae of the back; a back-breaking calamity. They say عمل به الفاقرة i.e. he did to him that which broke his back (Lane & Aqrab).

Commentary:

The Fall of Mecca broke the back of the Quraishite power.

ur: خبردار! جب جان ہنسلیوں تک پہنچ چکی ہوگی۔

v5.text: Hearken! when the soul of the dying man comes up to the throat[b],[4472]

notes.note:
Important Words:

التراقی (throat) is the plural of ترقوة meaning, the collarbone. They say بلغت روحه التراقی i.e. he was about to die. راقی means, the uppermost parts of the chest or parts of the throat next of the chest (Lane & Aqrab).

ur: اور کہا جائے گا کون ہے جھاڑ پھونک کرنے والا؟

v5.text: And it is said, ‘Who is the wizard to save him?’[4473]

notes.note:
Important Words:

راق (wizard) is derived from رقی. They say رقی الجبل i.e. he ascended the mountain. رقاه (raqqa) means, he charmed him or fascinated him by uttering a spell. راق means, one who charms; a charmer; one who ascends (Lane & Aqrab).

Commentary:

The verse may mean: (a) Who will ascend with the soul of the dying man, the angel of mercy who will take him to Paradise or the angel of punishment who will drag him to Hell? (b) Where is the wizard or charmer who will avert the approaching death or relieve the dying man of his agony?

ur: اور وہ اندازہ لگالے گا کہ اب جدائی (کا وقت) ہے۔

v5.text: And he is sure that it is the hour of parting;

ur: اور پنڈلی پنڈلی سے رگڑ کھا رہی ہوگی۔

v5.text: And one shank rubs against another shank in death agony;[4474]

notes.note:
Commentary:

The word الساق literally meaning shank, metaphorically signifies a calamity or affliction (27:45 & 68:43). The verse signifies that one affliction will be joined to another for the departed soul; the agony of leaving his near and dear ones behind will be joined to the agony of death and the punishment awaiting the disbeliever in the next world.

ur: اُس دن تیرے ربّ ہی کی طرف ہنکایا جانا ہے۔

v5.text: Unto thy Lord that day will be the driving.

ur: پس اُس نے نہ تصدیق کی اور نہ نماز پڑھی۔

v5.text: For he neither accepted the truth, nor offered Prayers[a];[4475]

notes.note:
Commentary:

صدق (accepted the truth) stands for right belief and صلی (offered Prayers) for good conduct, the two basic principles of the Islamic teaching. Prayer is the essence of عبادة which is total submission and conforming one’s conduct to Divine laws. Thus the verse purports to say that both the mind and body of disbelievers rebelled against God.

ur: بلکہ جھٹلایا اور منہ پھیر لیا۔

v5.text: [b]But he rejected the truth and turned his back;

ur: پھر اپنے اہل و عیال کی طرف اکڑتا ہوا گیا۔

v5.text: Then he went to his kinsfolk, strutting along in pride.[4476]

notes.note:
Important Words:

یتمطی (strutting) is from مط. They say مطی الشیء i.e. he stretched or lengthened the thing. مط خده means, he behaved proudly. یتمطی means, he strutted along (Aqrab).

Commentary:

False pride, arrogance and conceit are, as repeatedly stated in the Quran, at the root of all disbelief and rejection of the Divine Message and of opposition to God’s Prophets and Messengers.

ur: تجھ پر ہلاکت ہو۔ پھر ہلاکت ہو۔

v5.text: ‘Woe unto thee! and woe again!

ur: تجھ پر پھر ہلاکت ہو۔ پھر ہلاکت ہو۔

v5.text: Then woe unto thee! and woe again!’ [4477]

notes.note:
Commentary:

These two verses speak of a double punishment—mental agony and physical punishment, or punishment in this world and in the next.

ur: کیا انسان یہ گمان کرتا ہے کہ وہ بے لگام چھوڑ دیا جائے گا؟

v5.text: Does man think that he is to be left to himself uncontrolled?[4478]

notes.note:
Important Words:

سدی (uncontrolled) is derived from سدا. سدو (sadwun) which is inf. noun signifies going at random, heedlessly or in a headlong manner, without aim or object, not following a guide to the right course. ذھب کلامه سدی means, his discourse proved useless (Lane & Aqrab).

Commentary:

The verse reproachfully reminds the conceited and disdainful disbeliever of the grand object of his life and of his accountability before his Lord and Master in the Hereafter. Does man think that he has been created without an aim or object and that death is the end of all things, and that he will not be called upon to explain his conduct before his Lord in the next life? The whole idea is inconsistent with God’s Wisdom. It is inconceivable that God should have created man from an insignificant thing—from a sperm drop—and should have endowed him with such great natural powers and faculties as to make him the centre and pivot of all creation and then should have left him without control, to eat, drink and be merry. It is further clear from this verse that the Lord Who created him from such an insignificant beginning will give him a new life when he is dead and is reduced to crumbled bones and dust, to make spiritual progress which knows no end. This is the substance of the next four verses.

ar: اَلَمۡ  یَکُ نُطۡفَۃً  مِّنۡ  مَّنِیٍّ یُّمۡنٰی ﴿ۙ۳۸﴾
ur: کیا وہ محض منی کا ایک قطرہ نہیں تھا جو ڈالا گیا؟

v5.text: [a]Was he not a drop of fluid, emitted forth?

topics.topic: Blood: man born out of congealed

ur: تب وہ ایک لوتھڑا بن گیا۔ پس اُس نے اُس کی تخلیق کی پِھر اُسے توازن عطا کیا۔

v5.text: [b]Then he became a clot, then He shaped and perfected him.

ar: فَجَعَلَ مِنۡہُ  الزَّوۡجَیۡنِ الذَّکَرَ  وَ الۡاُنۡثٰی ﴿ؕ۴۰﴾
ur: پھر اُس میں سے جوڑا بنایا یعنی نَر اور مادہ۔

v5.text: [c]Then He made of him a pair, the male and female.
